SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.orbitz.monitoring.api.annotation
Annotation Type Monitored

@Target(value={METHOD,TYPE})
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Inherited
@Documented
public @interface Monitored

Declares that a class or method should be monitored.

The value property will be used as the monitor name. If a value is not provided, the intercepted method name will be used. Any value included when annotating a type will be ignored.

Optional Element Summary
 boolean includeArguments
          Indicates whether the intercepted method's arguments will be set on the monitor.
 boolean includeResult
          Indicates whether the result of the intercepted method will be included in the Monitor attributes.
 java.lang.String levelStr
          A string representation of the MonitoringLevel.
 java.lang.String value
          The name to use for the monitor.
 

value

public abstract java.lang.String value
The name to use for the monitor. If a value is not specified, the method name will be used.
TODO: Version 5: Change the default to null

Default:
""

levelStr

public abstract java.lang.String levelStr
A string representation of the MonitoringLevel. The default is "info".
FIXME: Version 5: Change this to "INFO" to match MonitoringLevel.INFO

Returns:
the level name
Default:
"info"

includeResult

public abstract boolean includeResult
Indicates whether the result of the intercepted method will be included in the Monitor attributes. If includeResult is true, then the result will be set on the Monitor using result as the key. Defaults to false.

Returns:
true if return values should be set into monitors, false otherwise
Default:
false

includeArguments

public abstract boolean includeArguments
Indicates whether the intercepted method's arguments will be set on the monitor. If true, then the arguments will be set on the monitor using arguments as the key. Defaults to false

Returns:
true if arguments should be set into monitors, false otherwise
Default:
false
